pr_title: Fix detection and application of logging changes

timeline.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText:
One can type anything in Kafka CR logging / loggers, including otherwise valid levels like FINE and FINEST which are perfectly valid for java util logging, but not for Log4j. The question is how do we want to proceed when an unsupported logging level is specified. Currently FINE and FINEST probably just break things so we have to add some exception catching.
We can remove OFF from enum, and handle it the same way as FINE, FINEST.
replies.author: mstruk

replies.bodyText: Actually the KIP-412 also does not seem to understand ALL level, so we should treat it as TRACE.
replies.author: mstruk

timeline.bodyText: Can you put there any doc?

replies.bodyText:
Maybe it's a wrong word. Some alternatives: 'obsolete', 'old', 'outdated'.
Completely reworded as in 'The logging level for {} category has changed' ...

timeline.author: see-quick

replies.bodyText: Not really. Long variables make code harder to read so they should be used judiciously. Here 'e' really stands for 'end index', but seems to me, that should be obvious.
